name: Lot Type
values: CIL-Civil Lot, DRL- Drainage Lot, EAL- Earthworks Lot, ELL- Electrical Lot, UTL- Utility Lot, STL- Structural Lot

name: Traffic Direction
values: EB - Eastbound, ME - Median, NB - Northbound, SB - Southbound, WB - Westbound

name: Acceptance Criteria: All personnel on site have been inducted to the CRU site
Record of conformity: Site induction signed.
1.2 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest Revision Drawings
1.3 - Confirm understanding of current Environment Management Plan (EMP) related to the work area and that all prescribed environemental controls are in place
Acceptance Criteria: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
Reference Documents: EMP, Site induction, Project Specification Cl. 1200.03
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
1.4 - Safety measures are in place, Safe Work Method Statement (SWMS) undertaken
Acceptance Criteria: As per Fulton Hogan Safety Strategy. All personnel on site to have signed onto relevant SWMS before commencing work.
Reference Documents: Project General Specsefication Cl.1125.07 Health and Safety Coordination Plan

Acceptance Criteria: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mix Designs as listed in Section 175.
Record of conformity: Mix Design VicRoads Approval
Acceptance Criteria: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Acceptance Criteria: Approved TMP and MOA
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Record of conformity: Approved TMP & MOA
Frequency: Check prior to placing material

Acceptance Criteria: * Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. * Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres * Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2 m.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl.304.07 (a, b & c)
Frequency: Check prior to placing material

Acceptance Criteria: * Material should be spread to minimize number of joints. * longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150 mm. * longitudinal joints shall be located within 300 mm of the planned position of traffic lanes lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl.304.07 (a, d & e)
Frequency: Check prior to placing material

Acceptance Criteria: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one day's production in a single layer, whichever is lesser. For pavement construction, any lot that has a surface area less than 500 m2 may be treated as a small area and tested in accordance with Section 173.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl.304.08 (b)(ii & iv) Table 304.111
Acceptance Criteria: Pavement lots should be subject to proof roll as outlined in VicRoads Section 173, under supervision of Superintendent
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl.304.08(b)(iv) Cl. 173
3.1 - Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency

Acceptance Criteria: Table 204.161 from VicRoads Standard nominates the level of testing required for acceptance of Surface Level Measurement. Scale A - Initially test every lot until 3 consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified in Clauses 304.08. and 304.10. If no failures, Reduced Frequency applies as specified in Table 304.111.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Table 204.161 VicRoads Specification Cl.304.08 (a) Cl.304.11 (b) Cl.304.11 (c)(i) Table 304.111
Inspection / Test Method: Document Review/ Site Inspection

Acceptance Criteria: Characteristic Value of Density Ratio for Subbase:- > 98.0% for Scale A and >97.0% for Scale B. For work to be tested for compliance with Scale A or Scale B requirements, the number of tests per lot shall be six.
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl. 304.08 (b) (iii) Table 304.081

Acceptance Criteria: Class 4 Crushed rock max 5x10^-9 m/sec. Class 3 Crushed rock max 5x10^-7 m/sec Where the Class 4 material is used as a levelling layer in a deep strength asphalt pavement, the Superintendent grants dispensation from 5x10-9 m/s Max permeability requirement in clause 3040.05(a) and table 3040.051
Reference Documents: Project Specification Cl.3040.05(a) Table 3040.051
Record of conformity: Test Records from Supplier
Acceptance Criteria: Post-compaction Plasticity Index must comply with the requirement of table 3040.053. Class 3: 0 <  PI < 10.
Reference Documents: Project Specification Cl.3040.05(a) Table 3040.053
Record of conformity: Test Records from Supplier
Acceptance Criteria: The post compaction grading shall comply with the requirements of table 304.101
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Cl. 304.10 Table 304.101
Record of conformity: Test Records from Supplier

Acceptance Criteria: Scale A: Minimum number of measurements per lot: 80 for Upper — Upper Subbase: Mean + 4mm to -8mm wit a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm — Lower Subbase: Mean +6mm to -10mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 10mm — Base: Mean +- 5 with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm
Reference Documents: VicRoads Specification Table 304.061 Table 304.062
